il.ac.technion.nlp.nli.core.dataset.visualization

Class StateVisualizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • il.ac.technion.nlp.nli.core.dataset.visualization.StateVisualizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public abstract class StateVisualizer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Generates a html code block which is a visualization for a given a state. Contains info regarding the way certain things are to be emphasized in the visualization (e.g. specific entities). IMPORTANT: The fields of all descendant classes (including itself) may not reference State and may only refer to NliEntity via id - so that when a StateVisualizer is valid for a State it's valid for its deep copies as well.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StateVisualizer()
      Initializes a default visualizer, which is one the emphasizes nothing.

    • Method Detail

      • getVisualRepresentation

        public abstract HtmlString getVisualRepresentation(State state)
        Returns:
        the visual representation of 'state', taking into account getEntityEmphasisInfo(String) and/or isEntityEntirelyEmphasized(String) (if relevant). It's completely legitimate scenario when some emphasis was defined to an entityId in state, and that entity was removed from 'state' before calling this method.

      • getEntityEmphasisInfo

        @Nullable
protected il.ac.technion.nlp.nli.core.dataset.visualization.StateVisualizer.EntityEmphasisInfo getEntityEmphasisInfo(java.lang.String entityId)
        If the EntityEmphasisInfo was never set for that entityId, null is returned.
